meanings.definition: To boast or brag about one's own abilities or achievements.
meanings.sent1: He kept tauting about his high score in the game.
meanings.sent2: She was tauting about her new job promotion to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat was tauting about catching a mouse, thinking it was a big deal.
meanings.sent4: The sun tauting its brightness, outshining all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The little boy was tauting his bravery, pretending to be a superhero.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise something in a boastful manner.
meanings.sent1: The company was tauting their new product as the best on the market.
meanings.sent2: The politician was tauting his policies as the solution to all problems.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was tauting its acorn collection, claiming it was the biggest in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The river tauting its strength, carving through the mountains with ease.
meanings.sent5: The chef was tauting his signature dish, calling it a culinary masterpiece.
